page.title: 15Bellister - National Trust.
page.content: Outside the castle is a very old {oak tree.} The distance around the trunk is 5 metres 10 centimetres. It used to have a very long thick branch where a long time ago they used to hang six men in a row if they had been caught cattle stealing in a Border raid. There is supposed to be the ghost of a minstrel who was torn to pieces by the Baron's dogs. He is called the {Grey Man}of Bellister. Part of the castle was burned down in 1901 and a new pretend castle was built by Dr Daniel Jackson of Hexham. His grandson, Edward Jackson, left it and the surrounding land, including Debbie's farm, to the{National Trust in 1975. You are allowed to go and look at the castle if you make an appointment first.
